raw: * A filtered table model to provide support for hiding and filtering table
* rows. Any rows that match any applied filters will be hidden.
* method to filter the table model

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
A filtered table model to provide support for hiding and filtering table rows. Any rows that match any applied filters will be hidden.

var model = new qx.ui.table.model.Filtered();
model.setColumns(["Login", "Name", "Email"], ["login", "name", "email"]);
var table = new qx.ui.table.Table(model);
var data = [{
  login : "darthvader",
  name : "Darth Vader",
  email : "darthvader@tatooine.org"
}, {
  login : "anakin",
  name : "Anakin Skywalker",
  email : "anakin@skywalker.org"
}, {
  login : "luke",
  name : "Luke Skywalker",
  email : "luke@tatooine.org"
}, {
  login : "obi-wan",
  name : "Obi-Wan Kenobi",
  email : "obiwan@jedi.org"
}, {
  login : "rey",
  name : "Rey",
  email : "rey@jakku.sw"
}];
model.setDataAsMapArray(data);
this.getRoot().add(table);
var search = new qx.ui.form.TextField();
search.set({
  liveUpdate : true,
  placeholder : "Search login"
});
search.addListener("changeValue", function(e) {
  var value = e.getData();
  model.resetHiddenRows();
  model.addNotRegex(value, "login", true);
  model.applyFilters();
});
this.getRoot().add(search, {top : 500, left : 10});

@deprecated.name: @deprecated
@deprecated.body: {6.0} You should use Array.filter method to filter the table model

raw: * The addBetweenFilter method is used to add a between filter to the
*    The type of filter. Accepted strings are "between" and "!between".
*    The first value to compare against.
*    The second value to compare against.
*    The text value of the column to compare against.
* @throws {Error} If the filter can not recognized or one of the values

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The addBetweenFilter method is used to add a between filter to the table model.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
filter {String}
    The type of filter. Accepted strings are "between" and "!between".
@param.description: The type of filter. Accepted strings are "between" and "!between".

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
value1 {Integer}
    The first value to compare against.
@param.description: The first value to compare against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
value2 {Integer}
    The second value to compare against.
@param.description: The second value to compare against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
target {String}
    The text value of the column to compare against.
@param.description: The text value of the column to compare against.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If the filter can not recognized or one of the values
 is null.
@throws.description:
If the filter can not recognized or one of the values
 is null.

raw: * The addNumericFilter method is used to add a basic numeric filter to
*    The type of filter. Accepted strings are:
*    The text value of the column to compare against.
* @throws {Error} If the filter can not recognized or the target is null.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The addNumericFilter method is used to add a basic numeric filter to the table model.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
The type of filter. Accepted strings are:
    "==", "!=", ">", "<", ">=", and "<=".

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
value1 {Integer}
    The value to compare against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
target {String}
    The text value of the column to compare against.
@param.description: The text value of the column to compare against.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the filter can not recognized or the target is null.
@throws.description: If the filter can not recognized or the target is null.

raw: * The addRegex method is used to add a regular expression filter to the

@param.description: The text value of the column to compare against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:

    If true, the regular expression will ignore case.
@param.description: If true, the regular expression will ignore case.

@throws.name: @throws
